categories.name: React Fun Projects
categories.description: Hands-on React mini projects to strengthen your component and state logic.

challenges.title: To-Do List App
challenges.shortDescription: Build a simple task tracker with add and delete functionality.
challenges.longDescription: Create a To-Do List app where users can add, mark complete, and delete tasks. This challenge helps understand React state management, lists rendering, and handling user interactions with controlled inputs.
challenges.tip: Start small ‚Äî focus first on adding tasks before handling delete or complete features.

challenges.title: Weather App
challenges.shortDescription: Fetch and display real-time weather using an API.
challenges.longDescription: Build a weather app that fetches live weather data based on a city name using a public API like OpenWeatherMap. Learn how to work with async/await, handle loading states, and display data dynamically.
learnPoints: Fetching data using fetch or axios
Handling form input and API calls
challenges.tip: Use async/await and try-catch to gracefully handle API errors.

challenges.title: Quote Generator
challenges.shortDescription: Display a random quote every time a button is clicked.
challenges.longDescription: Create a fun quote generator that shows a new motivational quote when a user clicks a button. You‚Äôll practice state updates, randomization logic, and simple UI interaction.
challenges.tip: Store your quotes in an array and use Math.random() to pick one randomly.

challenges.title: Expense Tracker
challenges.shortDescription: Track daily expenses and visualize totals.
challenges.longDescription: Build an expense tracker that lets users add income and expense records. Show total balance and category breakdowns. Learn state management and data filtering techniques.
learnPoints: Using multiple states and derived values
challenges.tip: Start with simple input and output; add filtering or charting later.

challenges.title: Countdown Timer
challenges.shortDescription: Create a countdown timer for any event.
challenges.longDescription: Users can set a date/time and see a real-time countdown. Learn how to use useEffect with timers and manage interval cleanup properly.
challenges.tip: Remember to clear the interval inside useEffect‚Äôs cleanup function.

challenges.title: Movie Search App
challenges.shortDescription: Search movies using a public movie API.
challenges.longDescription: Create a movie search app using the OMDb or TMDB API. Learn how to handle search input, display results dynamically, and manage loading states.
challenges.tip: Debounce your search input for better performance.

challenges.title: Quiz App
challenges.shortDescription: Build a multiple-choice quiz app with scoring.
challenges.longDescription: Create a quiz app that shows one question at a time, allows users to pick answers, and displays their score at the end. Great for practicing conditional rendering and logic.
challenges.tip: Use an array of questions and track the current index.

challenges.title: Image Gallery
challenges.shortDescription: Showcase a responsive image gallery with grid layout.
challenges.longDescription: Build an image gallery that displays photos in a responsive grid. Add hover effects or lightbox previews. Learn to map over data and create reusable UI components.
challenges.tip: You can fetch free images from Unsplash API for more realism.

challenges.title: Notes App
challenges.shortDescription: Create a simple note-taking app with local storage.
challenges.longDescription: Build a notes app that allows users to write, edit, and delete notes. Persist them in localStorage so they stay after refreshing.
challenges.tip: Always parse and stringify your localStorage data properly.

challenges.title: Random Joke Generator
challenges.shortDescription: Get a new joke with every button click.
challenges.longDescription: Create an app that fetches a random joke from a joke API. Learn to use fetch and update UI instantly after API calls.
challenges.tip: Add a loading spinner for a smoother experience.

challenges.title: Color Picker Tool
challenges.shortDescription: Create a tool to pick and copy hex colors.
challenges.longDescription: Build a fun color picker where users can select a color and copy its hex code. Explore useState and DOM interactions.
challenges.tip: Use input type='color' for native color picker support.

challenges.title: Music Player
challenges.shortDescription: A mini player to play, pause, and skip songs.
challenges.longDescription: Create a simple React music player that plays audio files from a list. Practice refs, event handling, and conditional rendering.
challenges.tip: Use HTML audio tag with React refs for easy control.

challenges.title: Pomodoro Timer
challenges.shortDescription: Build a timer to boost productivity with work/break intervals.
challenges.longDescription: Implement a Pomodoro Timer that lets users start, pause, and reset sessions. Learn time calculations, interval management, and state transitions.
challenges.tip: Keep your timer logic inside a useEffect for clean re-renders.

challenges.title: BMI Calculator
challenges.shortDescription: Calculate and display Body Mass Index results.
challenges.longDescription: Create a BMI calculator that takes height and weight input and displays BMI and status. Learn controlled forms and conditional display logic.
challenges.tip: Add color-coded feedback for underweight/normal/overweight.

categories.name: JavaScript Logic Challenges
categories.description: Pure JavaScript logic challenges to sharpen fundamentals.

challenges.title: Palindrome Checker
challenges.shortDescription: Check if a word or phrase reads the same backward and forward.
challenges.longDescription: Write a function that checks if a given string is a palindrome. Ignore casing, spaces, and punctuation. This challenge builds confidence in working with strings and loops or array methods like split, reverse, and join.
challenges.tip: Use regex or replace() to remove spaces and punctuation before checking.

challenges.title: Anagram Finder
challenges.shortDescription: Check if two words are anagrams of each other.
challenges.longDescription: Create a function that takes two strings and returns true if they contain the same letters in any order. You'll explore sorting strings and comparing them effectively.
challenges.tip: Try converting strings to lowercase and sort characters alphabetically before comparing.

challenges.title: FizzBuzz
challenges.shortDescription: Print numbers with Fizz/Buzz pattern logic.
challenges.longDescription: Classic interview question! Print numbers from 1 to 100. For multiples of 3 print 'Fizz', for 5 print 'Buzz', and for both print 'FizzBuzz'.
challenges.tip: Use modulo (%) operator to check divisibility by 3 and 5.

challenges.title: Array Chunking
challenges.shortDescription: Split an array into smaller groups of given size.
challenges.longDescription: Write a function that divides an array into subarrays (chunks) of a specific length. Helps understand array slicing and loops effectively.
challenges.tip: Try using a for loop that increments by chunk size each iteration.

challenges.title: Flatten Nested Arrays
challenges.shortDescription: Convert a nested array into a single flat array.
challenges.longDescription: Write a function that flattens deeply nested arrays into one single array. Learn recursion or use modern array methods like flat().
challenges.tip: If recursion is confusing, start with one-level flattening using concat().

challenges.title: Find the Missing Number
challenges.shortDescription: Detect the missing number in a sequence.
challenges.longDescription: Given an array of numbers from 1 to n with one missing, find which number is missing. Strengthen loop logic and arithmetic formula knowledge.
challenges.tip: Subtract the sum of array elements from the expected sum of numbers 1..n.

challenges.title: Count Vowels
challenges.shortDescription: Count vowels in a given string.
challenges.longDescription: Write a function that counts the number of vowels (a, e, i, o, u) in a string. This improves iteration and conditional logic skills.
challenges.tip: Use a regex like /[aeiou]/gi for cleaner implementation.

challenges.title: Find the Longest Word
challenges.shortDescription: Return the longest word in a given sentence.
challenges.longDescription: Split a sentence into words and find which one is the longest. Learn to manipulate arrays and use reduce effectively.
challenges.tip: Try sorting by word length to find the longest one quickly.

challenges.title: Capitalize Each Word
challenges.shortDescription: Transform the first letter of every word to uppercase.
challenges.longDescription: Build a function that converts a string like 'hello world' ‚Üí 'Hello World'. You‚Äôll understand string splitting, mapping, and joining.
challenges.tip: Remember to lowercase the rest of the word for consistency.

challenges.title: Array Intersection
challenges.shortDescription: Find common elements between two arrays.
challenges.longDescription: Create a function that takes two arrays and returns a new array with elements found in both. You‚Äôll understand filtering and includes() method well.
challenges.tip: Use Set to make comparisons faster for large arrays.

challenges.title: Sum of Digits
challenges.shortDescription: Find the sum of all digits in a number.
challenges.longDescription: Write a function that takes a number like 1234 and returns 10. Helps practice type conversion and loops.
challenges.tip: Use reduce() to sum digits after splitting the string.

challenges.title: Reverse Integer
challenges.shortDescription: Reverse the digits of an integer.
challenges.longDescription: Given a number, return it reversed. Example: 123 ‚Üí 321, -456 ‚Üí -654. Learn handling strings and edge cases like negatives.
challenges.tip: Convert to string ‚Üí reverse ‚Üí convert back to number.

challenges.title: Factorial Finder
challenges.shortDescription: Calculate the factorial of a number using recursion or loops.
challenges.longDescription: Build a factorial function (n!) using recursion or a for loop. Great for practicing function calls and understanding base cases.
challenges.tip: Start with an iterative solution, then refactor it to recursion.

challenges.title: Count Occurrences
challenges.shortDescription: Count how many times each element appears in an array.
challenges.longDescription: Return an object showing frequency of each element. Example: ['a','b','a'] ‚Üí {a:2,b:1}. Learn object-based counting patterns.
challenges.tip: Initialize counts using result[element] = (result[element] || 0) + 1.

challenges.title: Find Duplicates
challenges.shortDescription: Detect duplicates inside an array.
challenges.longDescription: Write a function that returns duplicate elements from an array. Learn about sets, filtering, and memory-efficient comparison.
challenges.tip: Track seen elements in a Set for efficient duplicate detection.

challenges.title: Flatten Object
challenges.shortDescription: Convert nested objects into a single level with dot keys.
challenges.longDescription: Take an object like {a:{b:{c:1}}} ‚Üí {'a.b.c':1}. Practice recursion and object traversal.
challenges.tip: Pass current key path as a parameter in recursive calls.

challenges.title: Validate Parentheses
challenges.shortDescription: Check if parentheses in a string are balanced.
challenges.longDescription: Given a string like '(())' or '(()', determine if parentheses are balanced. Learn about stacks and loop-based validation.
challenges.tip: Push '(' and pop ')' ‚Äî if stack isn‚Äôt empty at end, it‚Äôs invalid.

challenges.title: Array Rotation
challenges.shortDescription: Rotate an array k times to the right.
challenges.longDescription: Move elements right by k steps. Example: [1,2,3,4,5], k=2 ‚Üí [4,5,1,2,3]. Great for practicing array manipulation.
challenges.tip: Use slice(-k) and concat to rotate cleanly.

challenges.title: Roman Numeral Converter
challenges.shortDescription: Convert numbers into Roman numerals.
challenges.longDescription: Convert numbers like 9 ‚Üí IX or 58 ‚Üí LVIII. You‚Äôll understand mapping logic and string concatenation loops.
challenges.tip: Work from largest Roman symbol downward.

categories.name: API-Based Projects
categories.description: Practice fetching and displaying live data from APIs.

challenges.title: Weather Forecast App
challenges.shortDescription: Fetch real-time weather details using an external API.
challenges.longDescription: Build an app that allows users to search for a city and view its current weather, temperature, humidity, and forecast using APIs like OpenWeatherMap. You‚Äôll learn to handle API requests, manage states, and display data beautifully on the UI.
challenges.tip: Always handle API errors for invalid city names or network issues.

challenges.title: Movie Search Engine
challenges.shortDescription: Search and display movie details using OMDb or TMDB API.
challenges.longDescription: Create a movie search application that fetches data like movie titles, posters, ratings, and release years from a public movie API. You‚Äôll learn to manage API keys securely and render API data dynamically.
challenges.tip: Add debounce to your search input to reduce unnecessary API calls.

challenges.title: Crypto Tracker Dashboard
challenges.shortDescription: Track live cryptocurrency prices using CoinGecko or Binance API.
challenges.longDescription: Build a real-time dashboard displaying cryptocurrency prices, market caps, and 24h changes. You‚Äôll understand periodic API calls, data formatting, and updating UI with live data.
challenges.tip: Use `Intl.NumberFormat` for better currency formatting.

challenges.title: GitHub Profile Finder
challenges.shortDescription: Get user details and repositories using GitHub‚Äôs public API.
challenges.longDescription: Create an app where users can search for any GitHub username and view their profile details, followers, and repositories. Perfect for learning how to fetch nested API data and visualize profiles.
challenges.tip: Try adding pagination for repositories using GitHub‚Äôs pagination parameters.

challenges.title: Recipe Finder App
challenges.shortDescription: Find delicious recipes using ingredients via Spoonacular API.
challenges.longDescription: Allow users to input ingredients and fetch recipes with instructions, images, and nutrition info. This project strengthens your skills in handling API responses and creating user-friendly recipe UIs.
challenges.tip: Display a loading spinner while fetching recipes for better UX.

challenges.title: Random Quote Generator
challenges.shortDescription: Fetch and display random motivational quotes.
challenges.longDescription: Build a small app that fetches a new quote each time a button is clicked. You‚Äôll learn API fetching, state updates, and simple animations for dynamic content.
challenges.tip: Use a fade animation when updating the quote.

challenges.title: News Reader App
challenges.shortDescription: Display trending news using NewsAPI or GNews.
challenges.longDescription: Build a news portal that lists trending articles with headlines, sources, and images. Users can filter by category or keyword, improving your knowledge of query parameters and UI layouts.
challenges.tip: Display timestamps using readable date formats.

challenges.title: NASA Picture of the Day
challenges.shortDescription: Display daily space photos from NASA‚Äôs open API.
challenges.longDescription: Use NASA‚Äôs Astronomy Picture of the Day API to fetch fascinating space images and their descriptions. It‚Äôs a great project to practice fetching and formatting data with keys and dates.
challenges.tip: Allow users to select a custom date to fetch that day‚Äôs picture.

challenges.title: Dictionary App
challenges.shortDescription: Fetch definitions, synonyms, and examples for words.
challenges.longDescription: Build a dictionary where users can type a word to get its meaning, part of speech, and example usage. Use a free dictionary API to practice data rendering and conditional UI updates.
challenges.tip: Show a friendly message if a word is not found.

challenges.title: Joke Generator App
challenges.shortDescription: Get random jokes from JokeAPI and display them with fun UI.
challenges.longDescription: A simple yet fun project where users can click a button to fetch and read random jokes. Great for learning API basics, button interactions, and smooth transitions.
challenges.tip: Add a laugh emoji animation after showing each joke!

challenges.title: Currency Converter
challenges.shortDescription: Convert currencies using ExchangeRate or Frankfurter API.
challenges.longDescription: Create a converter where users can choose two currencies and get the live conversion rate. A perfect project for understanding inputs, dropdowns, and real-time API data.
challenges.tip: Use flag icons for visual currency selectors.

challenges.title: Book Finder App
challenges.shortDescription: Find books using Google Books API.
challenges.longDescription: Build a book search interface that displays covers, titles, and authors. Practice query string usage and conditional rendering for missing data.
challenges.tip: Use skeleton loaders while fetching data.

challenges.title: IP Location Tracker
challenges.shortDescription: Get geographical location data from IP address.
challenges.longDescription: Build an app where users enter an IP to get country, city, timezone, and map view using APIs like ipify or ipapi. Strengthens API chaining and map integration skills.
challenges.tip: Add automatic IP detection for user‚Äôs own location.

challenges.title: AI Image Generator
challenges.shortDescription: Generate images using an AI API like Unsplash or OpenAI.
challenges.longDescription: Create an app where users can type prompts to generate or fetch AI-generated images. You‚Äôll explore advanced APIs, image grids, and error handling.
challenges.tip: Display image loading shimmer placeholders.

challenges.title: Spotify Song Search Clone
challenges.shortDescription: Search and play previews of songs using Spotify API.
challenges.longDescription: Integrate Spotify‚Äôs API to build a mini music browser. Users can search songs, see artist info, and play previews. Focuses on API authorization and audio element control.
challenges.tip: Cache API responses to reduce load times.

challenges.title: AI Chat App
challenges.shortDescription: Build an interactive chatbot using OpenAI API.
challenges.longDescription: Create a simple chat UI where users can type questions and get intelligent answers using an AI API. Perfect to learn POST requests, managing chat states, and rendering lists dynamically.
challenges.tip: Use a typing animation to mimic real chat behavior.

challenges.title: Unsplash Image Gallery
challenges.shortDescription: Create an image search app using Unsplash API.
challenges.longDescription: Fetch and display high-quality photos from Unsplash. Learn pagination, search filters, and grid layouts with responsive design.
challenges.tip: Implement lazy loading for performance.

challenges.title: YouTube Video Explorer
challenges.shortDescription: Search and embed videos using YouTube Data API.
challenges.longDescription: Build a simple YouTube explorer that lets users search and play embedded videos. You‚Äôll learn about API quotas, pagination, and iframe embedding.
challenges.tip: Use `react-player` for cleaner embedding.

challenges.title: Country Info Explorer
challenges.shortDescription: View details of countries using REST Countries API.
challenges.longDescription: Show country details like population, capital, flag, and region. Add a search bar or filter by continent to improve interactivity.
challenges.tip: Add a dark mode for better aesthetics.

challenges.title: Public Holidays Finder
challenges.shortDescription: Find holidays by country and year using Calendarific API.
challenges.longDescription: Build an app that lists national holidays for any country and year. You‚Äôll learn about date formatting, dropdowns, and API parameters.
challenges.tip: Display holidays in a calendar-style layout.

categories.name: React + Advanced Hooks
categories.description: Deep dive into advanced React patterns and hooks.

challenges.title: Custom Hook for Fetching Data
challenges.shortDescription: Create a reusable custom hook for fetching APIs efficiently.
challenges.longDescription: Build a custom hook named `useFetch` that can fetch data from any given URL and handle loading and error states. You‚Äôll learn abstraction and reusability of logic using custom hooks instead of repeating code in multiple components.
challenges.tip: Return `{ data, loading, error }` from the hook for flexible use in different components.

challenges.title: Theme Switcher with Context API
challenges.shortDescription: Implement global light/dark mode using Context and useContext.
challenges.longDescription: Build a global theme switcher that allows toggling between light and dark mode using React Context. You‚Äôll understand how to manage and share state across deeply nested components.
challenges.tip: Store user‚Äôs theme preference in localStorage so it persists across reloads.

challenges.title: Form State Management with useReducer
challenges.shortDescription: Handle complex form state using useReducer instead of multiple useStates.
challenges.longDescription: Build a registration form where all form fields (name, email, password) are managed via `useReducer`. You‚Äôll learn to organize state transitions more cleanly for large-scale forms.
challenges.tip: Define an initialState object and switch-based reducer for clarity.

challenges.title: Debounced Search with useEffect and useRef
challenges.shortDescription: Implement search input that fetches data only after user stops typing.
challenges.longDescription: Build a movie or product search component where the API call triggers only after the user stops typing for 500ms. You‚Äôll explore performance optimization using `useEffect`, `useRef`, and cleanup functions.
challenges.tip: Use `setTimeout` and clear it in cleanup to achieve smooth debouncing.

challenges.title: Local Storage Manager Hook
challenges.shortDescription: Create a custom hook that syncs React state with localStorage.
challenges.longDescription: Develop a `useLocalStorage` hook to persist and retrieve user preferences. It improves UX by storing data even after reloads and teaches you how to combine `useEffect` and `useState` efficiently.
challenges.tip: Always check if localStorage contains data before setting defaults.

challenges.title: Infinite Scroll with useRef and Intersection Observer
challenges.shortDescription: Load more content automatically as the user scrolls down.
challenges.longDescription: Create an infinite scroll component that loads more data when the user reaches the bottom. You‚Äôll learn how to use `useRef` with Intersection Observer API to detect element visibility.
challenges.tip: Throttle updates to avoid overloading the API with too many calls.

challenges.title: Modal Component with usePortal
challenges.shortDescription: Build a reusable modal that uses React Portals for rendering.
challenges.longDescription: Create a modal that renders outside the root DOM tree using portals. This challenge teaches how to use `ReactDOM.createPortal` and manage visibility state elegantly.
challenges.tip: Use `useEffect` to close the modal on Escape key press.

challenges.title: Drag and Drop with useRef
challenges.shortDescription: Implement drag-and-drop sorting using hooks and refs.
challenges.longDescription: Build a draggable list using `useRef` and mouse events. You‚Äôll learn DOM manipulation, handling drag events, and updating state dynamically with modern React patterns.
challenges.tip: Use CSS transitions for smoother reordering animations.

challenges.title: Online/Offline Detector Hook
challenges.shortDescription: Detect internet connection changes using a custom hook.
challenges.longDescription: Create a custom hook `useNetworkStatus` that listens for browser online/offline events. Display a toast or banner when the network status changes.
challenges.tip: Return a boolean value so it‚Äôs reusable in multiple components.

challenges.title: Clipboard Manager Hook
challenges.shortDescription: Copy and manage clipboard data using React hooks.
challenges.longDescription: Build a custom `useClipboard` hook that lets users copy text to clipboard and show a confirmation message. You‚Äôll learn interacting with the browser Clipboard API using hooks.
challenges.tip: Use `setTimeout` to reset copied status after a few seconds.

challenges.title: Stopwatch with useReducer and useRef
challenges.shortDescription: Create a precise stopwatch using useReducer and useRef.
challenges.longDescription: Develop a stopwatch with start, stop, and reset functionality. Use `useReducer` for time state and `useRef` to store the timer ID without causing re-renders.
challenges.tip: Use Date.now() for accurate elapsed time calculation.

challenges.title: Undo/Redo State Manager
challenges.shortDescription: Build an undo-redo system using useReducer and history tracking.
challenges.longDescription: Create an app where users can undo or redo their actions (like drawing or editing text). You‚Äôll explore advanced reducer patterns and immutable state updates.
challenges.tip: Store past, present, and future states in your reducer.

challenges.title: Custom usePrevious Hook
challenges.shortDescription: Track and compare previous state or prop values.
challenges.longDescription: Build a simple yet powerful `usePrevious` hook that stores and returns the previous value of any variable. You‚Äôll understand how refs can persist data between renders.
challenges.tip: Always update the ref after returning the old value.

challenges.title: Scroll-to-Top Button Hook
challenges.shortDescription: Show a floating button when user scrolls down the page.
challenges.longDescription: Create a hook `useScrollPosition` to detect scroll position and show a button that scrolls the window smoothly to the top. Great for understanding window events and performance control.
challenges.tip: Use `window.scrollTo({ top: 0, behavior: 'smooth' })` for better UX.

challenges.title: Tabs Component with useState & useEffect
challenges.shortDescription: Build a tabbed interface that remembers the last active tab.
challenges.longDescription: Develop a tab component with localStorage memory, so the user‚Äôs last active tab stays selected even after refreshing. It‚Äôs a great example of syncing hooks and browser storage.
challenges.tip: Keep tab labels dynamic using props or context.

challenges.title: Countdown Timer with useEffect
challenges.shortDescription: Create a countdown timer that updates every second.
challenges.longDescription: Build a countdown that decreases by 1 every second using useEffect and cleanup. This strengthens your understanding of effect timing and dependencies.
challenges.tip: Clear the interval when the timer hits zero to prevent memory leaks.

challenges.title: Responsive Navbar with useLayoutEffect
challenges.shortDescription: Adjust navigation layout dynamically based on screen width.
challenges.longDescription: Use `useLayoutEffect` to detect layout changes and resize events to optimize responsive navigation. You‚Äôll understand when and why to use layout effects over normal effects.
challenges.tip: Use debounce for resize events to prevent performance issues.

challenges.title: WebSocket Chat with useEffect
challenges.shortDescription: Implement real-time chat using WebSockets and useEffect.
challenges.longDescription: Build a lightweight chat app that uses WebSocket for real-time updates. You‚Äôll learn how to open, listen, and close sockets properly with hooks.
challenges.tip: Ensure socket cleanup on component unmount to avoid leaks.

challenges.title: Animation Trigger with useInView Hook
challenges.shortDescription: Animate components when they enter the viewport.
challenges.longDescription: Create a hook using Intersection Observer that triggers animations when elements scroll into view. This project focuses on UI enhancement using advanced React and browser APIs.
challenges.tip: Combine with Framer Motion for smooth entrance animations.

challenges.title: Media Player Hook
challenges.shortDescription: Build a custom hook to manage video/audio playback.
challenges.longDescription: Create a `useMediaPlayer` hook to control play, pause, volume, and seek functionalities. Perfect for understanding controlled components with refs and effects.
challenges.tip: Expose functions like `play`, `pause`, and `togglePlay` from the hook.

categories.name: Data Visualization

challenges.longDescription:

üí° **Hint:** Customize colors, tooltips, and labels.

üß± **What you‚Äôll learn:** Chart data structure, options config, and interactivity.
challenges.tip: Experiment with cutout and border radius.

categories.name: Mini Games
categories.description: Fun interactive projects to improve your React event handling and logic.

challenges.title: Tic Tac Toe
challenges.shortDescription: Classic X/O game using React state.
challenges.longDescription:
üß≠ **Where to start:** Represent the board as an array of 9 items. Render buttons for each square and track turns.

üí° **Hint:** Detect wins by checking array combinations.

üß± **What you‚Äôll learn:** State logic, game rules, and conditional rendering.
